content: What are the key things I should focus on in my trading strategy?

Based on your trading history, I see you're performing well with your breakout strategy (68% win rate). Key focuses: 1) Risk management - stick to 1-2% risk per trade, 2) Wait for proper consolidation before entries, 3) Use volume confirmation for breakouts, 4) Keep detailed journal entries to track emotional states.
I'm struggling with news trading. Any tips?

News trading is challenging but profitable when done right. Focus on: 1) Prepare the day before - analyze what events are coming, 2) Set alerts for important releases, 3) Wait 5-10 minutes after the release for initial volatility to settle, 4) Look for overreactions and trade the reversal, 5) Use tighter stops during news events.
My GBP/USD trades keep getting stopped out early. What's wrong?

I see from your recent trades that you're getting stopped out on GBP/USD with stops around 12-15 pips. Consider: 1) GBP is more volatile - you might need wider stops, 2) Check if you're setting stops too close to current price during consolidation, 3) Look at historical ATR to set appropriate stop distances, 4) Consider entering during better time sessions (London vs Asian).
